        I assume this change is the culprit:<span class="line"><!---->I assume this change is the culprit:<!----></span><br><br>Avoid overflow when profiling builtins<span class="line"><!---->Avoid overflow when profiling builtins<!----></span><br><br>The basic block instrumentation currently uses 32-bit integers, which<span class="line"><!---->The basic block instrumentation currently uses 32-bit integers, which<!----></span><br>could overflow during a long profiling session. I considered upgrading<span class="line"><!---->could overflow during a long profiling session. I considered upgrading<!----></span><br>them to 64-bit integers, but generating the correct instrumentation code<span class="line"><!---->them to 64-bit integers, but generating the correct instrumentation code<!----></span><br>for various architectures would be rather non-trivial. Instead, this<span class="line"><!---->for various architectures would be rather non-trivial. Instead, this<!----></span><br>change uses 64-bit floating-point values, which are simple and also have<span class="line"><!---->change uses 64-bit floating-point values, which are simple and also have<!----></span><br>the nice behavior that they saturate rather than overflowing.<span class="line"><!---->the nice behavior that they saturate rather than overflowing.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: v8:10470<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/v8/issues/detail?id=10470" title="Tracking bug: profile-guided optimization of builtins"><!---->Bug: v8:10470<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I60f7456cb750091809803c03a85dd348dc614b58<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I60f7456cb750091809803c03a85dd348dc614b58<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Tobias Tebbi <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Tobias Tebbi &lt;<!----></span>tebbi@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tebbi@chromium.org"><!---->tebbi@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Commit-Queue: Seth Brenith <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Seth Brenith &lt;<!----></span>seth.brenith@microsoft.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/seth.brenith@microsoft.com"><!---->seth.brenith@microsoft.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>I could imagine a few solutions to the immediate bug; I'd appreciate any recommendations.<span class="line"><!---->I could imagine a few solutions to the immediate bug; I'd appreciate any recommendations.<!----></span><br><br>1. Revert that change: overflow isn't a very big deal, and any counter that overflows by a little bit probably overflows by a lot and gets up into high values again.<span class="line"><!---->1. Revert that change: overflow isn't a very big deal, and any counter that overflows by a little bit probably overflows by a lot and gets up into high values again.<!----></span><br>2. Use 32-bit int counters but add saturation logic. (This is my preferred solution, unless folks have arguments for others.)<span class="line"><!---->2. Use 32-bit int counters but add saturation logic. (This is my preferred solution, unless folks have arguments for others.)<!----></span><br>3. Use 64-bit int counters and assume they won't overflow.<span class="line"><!---->3. Use 64-bit int counters and assume they won't overflow.<!----></span><br>4. Add save and restore of FP registers to the builtin (the callee), if it uses them.<span class="line"><!---->4. Add save and restore of FP registers to the builtin (the callee), if it uses them.<!----></span><br>5. Add save and restore of FP registers to whatever code calls that builtin, if v8_enable_builtins_profiling was true during build.<span class="line"><!---->5. Add save and restore of FP registers to whatever code calls that builtin, if v8_enable_builtins_profiling was true during build.<!----></span><br><br>The real safety concern here is the idea that builtins could be changed in such a way that they use registers they're not allowed to, but mksnapshot still succeeds without any errors. Is there a way that we can inform the register allocator that FP registers are banned during RecordWrite? Are there other builtins with similiar hidden requirements?<span class="line"><!---->The real safety concern here is the idea that builtins could be changed in such a way that they use registers they're not allowed to, but mksnapshot still succeeds without any errors. Is there a way that we can inform the register allocator that FP registers are banned during RecordWrite? Are there other builtins with similiar hidden requirements?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263"><!---->a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263<!----></a><br>Author: Seth Brenith <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Seth Brenith &lt;<!----></span>seth.brenith@microsoft.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/seth.brenith@microsoft.com"><!---->seth.brenith@microsoft.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Feb 10 14:15:20 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Feb 10 14:15:20 2021<!----></span><br><br>Don't use floating-point values in basic block instrumentation<span class="line"><!---->Don't use floating-point values in basic block instrumentation<!----></span><br><br>Previously in <span class="line"><!---->Previously in <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573<!----></a><br>I updated BasicBlockInstrumentor to use 64-bit floating-point values<span class="line"><!---->I updated BasicBlockInstrumentor to use 64-bit floating-point values<!----></span><br>rather than 32-bit integers, so that it could never overflow. However,<span class="line"><!---->rather than 32-bit integers, so that it could never overflow. However,<!----></span><br>I've now learned that some builtins (particularly RecordWrite) are not<span class="line"><!---->I've now learned that some builtins (particularly RecordWrite) are not<!----></span><br>allowed to use floating-point registers, and so running with<span class="line"><!---->allowed to use floating-point registers, and so running with<!----></span><br>basic block instrumentation enabled could produce incorrect results.<span class="line"><!---->basic block instrumentation enabled could produce incorrect results.<!----></span><br>This change switches back to 32-bit integers, but adds saturation logic.<span class="line"><!---->This change switches back to 32-bit integers, but adds saturation logic.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1170776<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1170776" title="Security: V8 Incorrect array bounds calculation"><!---->Bug: chromium:1170776<!----></a><br>Change-Id:         Hello, Rene. I want to extend my apologies as the VRP Panel has decline to reward this issue since it occurs with the use of a non-standard flag for debugging and would not be enabled in production. Thank you for your efforts and best of luck in your research!<span class="line"><!---->Hello, Rene. I want to extend my apologies as the VRP Panel has decline to reward this issue since it occurs with the use of a non-standard flag for debugging and would not be enabled in production. Thank you for your efforts and best of luck in your research!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }

          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

// Load and instantiate pRPC client before any other script.
window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);
<script type="module" nonce="">
// Load and instantiate pRPC client before any other script.
window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);
</script>

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {

 }
 }
 });

  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;

    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }

    line-height: 1.6;
  }

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        Description #1 by renef...@yahoo.de (Jan 26, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I found a bug when I was fuzzing a v8 binary compiled with v8_enable_builtins_profiling=true. I'm not sure if the PoC can be modified to also trigger the vulnerability without the flag because I didn't analyze it yet. The bug leads to an incorrect array index calculation in the compiler which removes the array bound check (replaces it with a SIGTRAP).<span class="line"><!---->I found a bug when I was fuzzing a v8 binary compiled with v8_enable_builtins_profiling=true. I'm not sure if the PoC can be modified to also trigger the vulnerability without the flag because I didn't analyze it yet. The bug leads to an incorrect array index calculation in the compiler which removes the array bound check (replaces it with a SIGTRAP).<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>V8 version 8.9.0 (candidate)<span class="line"><!---->V8 version 8.9.0 (candidate)<!----></span><br>Commit Hash: <span class="line"><!---->Commit Hash: <!----></span>76d6f06abbd0dbae758d74d7829ae32f012246e0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/76d6f06abbd0dbae758d74d7829ae32f012246e0"><!---->76d6f06abbd0dbae758d74d7829ae32f012246e0<!----></a><br>Compiled with:<span class="line"><!---->Compiled with:<!----></span><br>gn gen out/fuzzbuild --args='is_debug=false dcheck_always_on=true v8_enable_builtins_profiling=true v8_static_library=true v8_enable_slow_dchecks=true v8_enable_v8_checks=true v8_enable_verify_heap=true v8_enable_verify_csa=true v8_fuzzilli=true v8_enable_verify_predictable=true sanitizer_coverage_flags="trace-pc-guard" target_cpu="x64"'<span class="line"><!---->gn gen out/fuzzbuild --args='is_debug=false dcheck_always_on=true v8_enable_builtins_profiling=true v8_static_library=true v8_enable_slow_dchecks=true v8_enable_v8_checks=true v8_enable_verify_heap=true v8_enable_verify_csa=true v8_fuzzilli=true v8_enable_verify_predictable=true sanitizer_coverage_flags="trace-pc-guard" target_cpu="x64"'<!----></span><br>ninja -C ./out/fuzzbuild<span class="line"><!---->ninja -C ./out/fuzzbuild<!----></span><br><br>The important flag to trigger the vulnerability is: "v8_enable_builtins_profiling=true".<span class="line"><!---->The important flag to trigger the vulnerability is: "v8_enable_builtins_profiling=true".<!----></span><br>Without this flag the vulnerability is not triggered.<span class="line"><!---->Without this flag the vulnerability is not triggered.<!----></span><br>I also verified the bug in older v8 versions.<span class="line"><!---->I also verified the bug in older v8 versions.<!----></span><br><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04 (but it should not matter)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04 (but it should not matter)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// Test 1: Without triggering the bug<span class="line"><!---->// Test 1: Without triggering the bug<!----></span><br>let x = 0;<span class="line"><!---->let x = 0;<!----></span><br>for (var var_1_ = 0; var_1_ < 20; var_1_++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (var var_1_ = 0; var_1_ &lt; 20; var_1_++) {<!----></span><br>  var var_2_ = -0;<span class="line"><!---->  var var_2_ = -0;<!----></span><br>  var var_3_ = [];<span class="line"><!---->  var var_3_ = [];<!----></span><br>  for (var var_4_ = 0; var_4_ < 1000; var_4_++) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (var var_4_ = 0; var_4_ &lt; 1000; var_4_++) {<!----></span><br>	x  = var_4_ * var_2_;<span class="line"><!---->	x  = var_4_ * var_2_;<!----></span><br>	//var_3_[x] = var_4_;<span class="line"><!---->	//var_3_[x] = var_4_;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>print(x)	// Output should be 0<span class="line"><!---->print(x)	// Output should be 0<!----></span><br><br>// Test 2: Now trigger the bug<span class="line"><!---->// Test 2: Now trigger the bug<!----></span><br>let y = 0;<span class="line"><!---->let y = 0;<!----></span><br>for (var var_1_ = 0; var_1_ < 20; var_1_++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (var var_1_ = 0; var_1_ &lt; 20; var_1_++) {<!----></span><br>  var var_2_ = Math.min(-0,-0);	// Math.min(-0,-0) call was added<span class="line"><!---->  var var_2_ = Math.min(-0,-0);	// Math.min(-0,-0) call was added<!----></span><br>  var var_3_ = [];<span class="line"><!---->  var var_3_ = [];<!----></span><br>  for (var var_4_ = 0; var_4_ < 1000; var_4_++) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (var var_4_ = 0; var_4_ &lt; 1000; var_4_++) {<!----></span><br>	y  = var_4_ * var_2_;<span class="line"><!---->	y  = var_4_ * var_2_;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>print(y)		// Will print incorrectly: 39017943<span class="line"><!---->print(y)		// Will print incorrectly: 39017943<!----></span><br><br>// Test 3: Trigger the bug with a OOB access (which is currently mitigated by a SIGTRAP)<span class="line"><!---->// Test 3: Trigger the bug with a OOB access (which is currently mitigated by a SIGTRAP)<!----></span><br>let z = 0;<span class="line"><!---->let z = 0;<!----></span><br>for (var var_1_ = 0; var_1_ < 20; var_1_++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (var var_1_ = 0; var_1_ &lt; 20; var_1_++) {<!----></span><br>  var var_2_ = Math.min(-0,-0);	// Math.min() call was added<span class="line"><!---->  var var_2_ = Math.min(-0,-0);	// Math.min() call was added<!----></span><br>  var var_3_ = [];<span class="line"><!---->  var var_3_ = [];<!----></span><br>  for (var var_4_ = 0; var_4_ < 1000; var_4_++) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (var var_4_ = 0; var_4_ &lt; 1000; var_4_++) {<!----></span><br>	z  = var_4_ * var_2_;<span class="line"><!---->	z  = var_4_ * var_2_;<!----></span><br>	var_3_[z] = var_4_;		// Will SIGRAP<span class="line"><!---->	var_3_[z] = var_4_;		// Will SIGRAP<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>print(z)<span class="line"><!---->print(z)<!----></span><br><br><br>EXPECTED OUTPUT:<span class="line"><!---->EXPECTED OUTPUT:<!----></span><br>0<span class="line"><!---->0<!----></span><br>0<span class="line"><!---->0<!----></span><br>0<span class="line"><!---->0<!----></span><br><br>REAL OUTPUT:<span class="line"><!---->REAL OUTPUT:<!----></span><br>0<span class="line"><!---->0<!----></span><br>39017943<span class="line"><!---->39017943<!----></span><br>Trace/breakpoint trap (core dumped)<span class="line"><!---->Trace/breakpoint trap (core dumped)<!----></span><br><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Rene Freingruber (@ReneFreingruber)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Rene Freingruber (@ReneFreingruber)<!----></span><br><br><br>Additional Information:<span class="line"><!---->Additional Information:<!----></span><br>I found this vulnerability/bug while preparing my fuzzer for Fuzzilli Research Grant Program which I will start soon. I found it some weeks ago and wanted to analyze it before I submit it here (to ensure the vulnerability is exploitable). I think the vulnerability is exploitable because this blog post from Google demonstrates a real-world bypass of the SIGTRAP patch:<span class="line"><!---->I found this vulnerability/bug while preparing my fuzzer for Fuzzilli Research Grant Program which I will start soon. I found it some weeks ago and wanted to analyze it before I submit it here (to ensure the vulnerability is exploitable). I think the vulnerability is exploitable because this blog post from Google demonstrates a real-world bypass of the SIGTRAP patch:<!----></span><br>https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2021/01/in-wild-series-chrome-infinity-bug.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2021/01/in-wild-series-chrome-infinity-bug.html"><!---->https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2021/01/in-wild-series-chrome-infinity-bug.html<!----></a><br>Moreover, this blog also describes a bypass:<span class="line"><!---->Moreover, this blog also describes a bypass:<!----></span><br>https://doar-e.github.io/blog/2019/05/09/circumventing-chromes-hardening-of-typer-bugs/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://doar-e.github.io/blog/2019/05/09/circumventing-chromes-hardening-of-typer-bugs/"><!---->https://doar-e.github.io/blog/2019/05/09/circumventing-chromes-hardening-of-typer-bugs/<!----></a><br>So in my opinion the vulnerability is exploitable under the condition, that the PoC can be modified to trigger the vulnerability without the "v8_enable_builtins_profiling=true" compilation flag (which I currently don't know but I assume that it's possible to trigger it without the flag). I didn't analyzed yet, if this is possible. <span class="line"><!---->So in my opinion the vulnerability is exploitable under the condition, that the PoC can be modified to trigger the vulnerability without the "v8_enable_builtins_profiling=true" compilation flag (which I currently don't know but I assume that it's possible to trigger it without the flag). I didn't analyzed yet, if this is possible. <!----></span><br>I'm sending the PoC today because Google Threat Analysis Group released today this blog post:<span class="line"><!---->I'm sending the PoC today because Google Threat Analysis Group released today this blog post:<!----></span><br>https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/new-campaign-targeting-security-researchers/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/new-campaign-targeting-security-researchers/"><!---->https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/new-campaign-targeting-security-researchers/<!----></a><br><br>One of the mentioned profiles (James Willy @james0x40) send a visual studio project to my system (and I also opened their blog). I didn't open their file and I therefore assume that they didn't compromise my system. But since I'm not 100% sure and I had the PoC on the system, I wanted to send you the PoC as soon as possible.<span class="line"><!---->One of the mentioned profiles (James Willy @james0x40) send a visual studio project to my system (and I also opened their blog). I didn't open their file and I therefore assume that they didn't compromise my system. But since I'm not 100% sure and I had the PoC on the system, I wanted to send you the PoC as soon as possible.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
      <div>
        
      </div>

        I walked backward through a time travel trace for a while and found that Builtins_RecordWrite is overwriting xmm0, which does not get restored after the return. Apparently the runtime-generated code didn't expect this to happen.<span class="line"><!---->I walked backward through a time travel trace for a while and found that Builtins_RecordWrite is overwriting xmm0, which does not get restored after the return. Apparently the runtime-generated code didn't expect this to happen.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I assume this change is the culprit:<span class="line"><!---->I assume this change is the culprit:<!----></span><br><br>Avoid overflow when profiling builtins<span class="line"><!---->Avoid overflow when profiling builtins<!----></span><br><br>The basic block instrumentation currently uses 32-bit integers, which<span class="line"><!---->The basic block instrumentation currently uses 32-bit integers, which<!----></span><br>could overflow during a long profiling session. I considered upgrading<span class="line"><!---->could overflow during a long profiling session. I considered upgrading<!----></span><br>them to 64-bit integers, but generating the correct instrumentation code<span class="line"><!---->them to 64-bit integers, but generating the correct instrumentation code<!----></span><br>for various architectures would be rather non-trivial. Instead, this<span class="line"><!---->for various architectures would be rather non-trivial. Instead, this<!----></span><br>change uses 64-bit floating-point values, which are simple and also have<span class="line"><!---->change uses 64-bit floating-point values, which are simple and also have<!----></span><br>the nice behavior that they saturate rather than overflowing.<span class="line"><!---->the nice behavior that they saturate rather than overflowing.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: v8:10470<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/v8/issues/detail?id=10470" title="Tracking bug: profile-guided optimization of builtins"><!---->Bug: v8:10470<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I60f7456cb750091809803c03a85dd348dc614b58<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I60f7456cb750091809803c03a85dd348dc614b58<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Tobias Tebbi <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Tobias Tebbi &lt;<!----></span>tebbi@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tebbi@chromium.org"><!---->tebbi@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Commit-Queue: Seth Brenith <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Seth Brenith &lt;<!----></span>seth.brenith@microsoft.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/seth.brenith@microsoft.com"><!---->seth.brenith@microsoft.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br><br>I could imagine a few solutions to the immediate bug; I'd appreciate any recommendations.<span class="line"><!---->I could imagine a few solutions to the immediate bug; I'd appreciate any recommendations.<!----></span><br><br>1. Revert that change: overflow isn't a very big deal, and any counter that overflows by a little bit probably overflows by a lot and gets up into high values again.<span class="line"><!---->1. Revert that change: overflow isn't a very big deal, and any counter that overflows by a little bit probably overflows by a lot and gets up into high values again.<!----></span><br>2. Use 32-bit int counters but add saturation logic. (This is my preferred solution, unless folks have arguments for others.)<span class="line"><!---->2. Use 32-bit int counters but add saturation logic. (This is my preferred solution, unless folks have arguments for others.)<!----></span><br>3. Use 64-bit int counters and assume they won't overflow.<span class="line"><!---->3. Use 64-bit int counters and assume they won't overflow.<!----></span><br>4. Add save and restore of FP registers to the builtin (the callee), if it uses them.<span class="line"><!---->4. Add save and restore of FP registers to the builtin (the callee), if it uses them.<!----></span><br>5. Add save and restore of FP registers to whatever code calls that builtin, if v8_enable_builtins_profiling was true during build.<span class="line"><!---->5. Add save and restore of FP registers to whatever code calls that builtin, if v8_enable_builtins_profiling was true during build.<!----></span><br><br>The real safety concern here is the idea that builtins could be changed in such a way that they use registers they're not allowed to, but mksnapshot still succeeds without any errors. Is there a way that we can inform the register allocator that FP registers are banned during RecordWrite? Are there other builtins with similiar hidden requirements?<span class="line"><!---->The real safety concern here is the idea that builtins could be changed in such a way that they use registers they're not allowed to, but mksnapshot still succeeds without any errors. Is there a way that we can inform the register allocator that FP registers are banned during RecordWrite? Are there other builtins with similiar hidden requirements?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263"><!---->a66f2b00cd70109a08956fdfa6106f7b144b2263<!----></a><br>Author: Seth Brenith <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Seth Brenith &lt;<!----></span>seth.brenith@microsoft.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/seth.brenith@microsoft.com"><!---->seth.brenith@microsoft.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Feb 10 14:15:20 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Feb 10 14:15:20 2021<!----></span><br><br>Don't use floating-point values in basic block instrumentation<span class="line"><!---->Don't use floating-point values in basic block instrumentation<!----></span><br><br>Previously in <span class="line"><!---->Previously in <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/2545573<!----></a><br>I updated BasicBlockInstrumentor to use 64-bit floating-point values<span class="line"><!---->I updated BasicBlockInstrumentor to use 64-bit floating-point values<!----></span><br>rather than 32-bit integers, so that it could never overflow. However,<span class="line"><!---->rather than 32-bit integers, so that it could never overflow. However,<!----></span><br>I've now learned that some builtins (particularly RecordWrite) are not<span class="line"><!---->I've now learned that some builtins (particularly RecordWrite) are not<!----></span><br>allowed to use floating-point registers, and so running with<span class="line"><!---->allowed to use floating-point registers, and so running with<!----></span><br>basic block instrumentation enabled could produce incorrect results.<span class="line"><!---->basic block instrumentation enabled could produce incorrect results.<!----></span><br>This change switches back to 32-bit integers, but adds saturation logic.<span class="line"><!---->This change switches back to 32-bit integers, but adds saturation logic.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1170776<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1170776" title="Security: V8 Incorrect array bounds calculation"><!---->Bug: chromium:1170776<!----></a><br>Change-Id:     <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

          flex-direction: row;

          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;

          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    color: var(--chops-link-color);

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }

    filter: brightness(95%);

  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

    text-decoration: underline;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>
